org.springframework.data.util

类 NullableUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.data.util.NullableUtils

  • public class NullableUtils
extends Object
    Utility methods to introspect nullability rules declared in packages, classes and methods.

    Nullability rules are declared using NonNullApi and Nullable and JSR-305 Nonnull annotations. By default (no annotation use), a package and its types are considered allowing null values in return values and method parameters. Nullability rules are expressed by annotating a package with a JSR-305 meta annotation such as Spring's NonNullApi. All types of the package inherit the package rule. Subpackages do not inherit nullability rules and must be annotated themself. 

     @org.springframework.lang.NonNullApi
 package com.example;
    Nullable selectively permits null values for method return values or method parameters by annotating the method respectively the parameters: 
     public class ExampleClass {

        String shouldNotReturnNull(@Nullable String acceptsNull, String doesNotAcceptNull) {
                // …
        }

        @Nullable
        String nullableReturn(String parameter) {
                // …
        }
 }

    Nonnull is suitable for composition of meta-annotations and expresses via Nonnull#when() in which cases non-nullability is applicable.

    从以下版本开始:
    2.0
    另请参阅:
    NonNullApi, Nullable, Nonnull

    • 方法详细资料

      • isNonNull

        public boolean isNonNull(Method method,
                         ElementType elementType)
        Determine whether ElementType in the scope of Method requires non-null values. Non-nullability rules are discovered from class and package annotations. Non-null is applied when Nonnull is set to meta.When.
        参数:
        type - the class to inspect.
        elementType - the element type.
        返回:
        true if ElementType allows null values by default.
        另请参阅:
        isNonNull(Annotation, ElementType)

      • isNonNull

        public boolean isNonNull(Class<?> type,
                         ElementType elementType)
        Determine whether ElementType in the scope of type requires non-null values. Non-nullability rules are discovered from class and package annotations. Non-null is applied when Nonnull is set to meta.When.
        参数:
        type - the class to inspect.
        elementType - the element type.
        返回:
        true if ElementType allows null values by default.
        另请参阅:
        isNonNull(Annotation, ElementType)

      • isNonNull

        public boolean isNonNull(AnnotatedElement element,
                         ElementType elementType)
        Determine whether ElementType in the scope of AnnotatedElement requires non-null values. This method determines default nullability rules from the annotated element
        参数:
        element - the scope of declaration, may be a Package, Class, or Method.
        elementType - the element type.
        返回:
        true if ElementType allows null values by default.

      • isExplicitNullable

        public static boolean isExplicitNullable(org.springframework.core.MethodParameter methodParameter)
        Determine whether a MethodParameter is explicitly annotated to be considered nullable. Nullability rules are discovered from method and parameter annotations. A MethodParameter is considered nullable when Nonnull is set to one of meta.When, meta.When, or meta.When.
        参数:
        methodParameter - the method parameter to inspect.
        返回:
        true if the parameter is nullable, false otherwise.
